text: Quvenzhané Wallis (born August 28, 2003) is an American actress. Wallis' first movie was Beasts of the Southern Wild. She got nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actress. This made her the youngest person ever to be nominated for the award. Wallis played Margaret Northup in the 2013 movie 12 Years a Slave. Wallis also played Annie in a remake of the musical Annie. Wallis does the voice of Almitra in the animated movie The Prophet. Wallis was born in Houma, Louisiana. ==References== Category:2003 births Category:Actors from Louisiana Category:African-American actors Category:Living people Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:African-American writers Category:Writers from Louisiana
title: Quvenzhané Wallis
